prompt: Facts: Incident occurred during the night between 13th and 14th June 1981.; Location: Village Titarwas, District Udaipur, Rajasthan, at the matrimonial home of the deceased.; Deceased: Smt. Pushpa Bai.; Accused: Narayan (husband), Bhonri Bai (mother-in-law), Chhotu (father-in-law).; Smt. Pushpa Bai sustained burn injuries at her in-laws' house.; She was admitted to the General Hospital, Udaipur.; A dying declaration (Ex. P-14) was recorded by Shri R.C. Mehta, Judicial Magistrate (PW 11), on 14th June 1981 at 9:30 AM.; Dr. P.C. Lodha (PW 7) certified Pushpa Bai's fit state of mind before the declaration was recorded.; In the dying declaration, Pushpa Bai stated that her mother-in-law (Bhonri Bai) poured kerosene on her, her husband (Narayan) lit the matchstick, and her father-in-law (Chhotu) caught hold of her.; Pushpa Bai succumbed to her burn injuries (reported as 100% burns) on the same day, 14th June 1981.; PW 1 (father of the deceased) and PW 2 (brother of the deceased) testified regarding prior demands for dowry (scooter, cash) and harassment faced by Pushpa Bai.; The defense plea was that Pushpa Bai caught fire accidentally while cooking.; The Sessions Judge, Udaipur, convicted Narayan (husband) under Section 302 IPC and sentenced him to life imprisonment. Bhonri Bai and Chhotu were acquitted.; Narayan appealed to the High Court of Rajasthan.; The High Court acquitted Narayan, disbelieving the dying declaration.; The State of Rajasthan filed an appeal to the Supreme Court against the High Court's order of acquittal concerning Narayan. | IPC: Section 302 (Punishment for Murder), Section 300 (Murder definition - applied contextually), Section 34 (Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention - relevant contextually due to dying declaration implicating three people, though only husband's appeal was before SC)
